items.title: Department of Public Health data reinforces that vaccines are highly effective against new delta variant
items.summary: New data from SF shows vaccines are powerful at preventing severe illness and hospitalizations; breakthrough cases are also present; SFDPH strongly recommends vaccination and indoor masking regardless of vaccination status.

items.title: Bay Area counties recommend masking indoors for everyone as a precaution against increased circulation of COVID-19
items.summary: San Francisco daily new cases have increased eight-fold and are projected to increase an average of at least 80 new cases per day.

items.title: City officials encourage residents to get vaccinated to combat COVID-19 variants
items.summary: San Francisco, along with all Bay Area counties, is seeing trend of rising COVID-19 cases due to the delta variant.

items.title: SF Health Officer Dr. Susan Philip on school reopening for full-time, in-person learning this fall
items.summary: “I agree with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) strong focus on getting children back in school safely when the school year begins this fall..."

items.title: Update to mask requirements in SF City facilities
items.summary: SF is removing face covering requirements for fully vaccinated people, in alignment with recently updated Cal/OSHA and state guidance.
